abstract: Like many large American multinationals, PepsiCo is seeking growth abroad as its domestic sales stagnate.
snippet: Like many large American multinationals, PepsiCo is seeking growth abroad as its domestic sales stagnate.
lead_paragraph: 7:45 p.m. | Updated  PepsiCo said Thursday that it had agreed to pay $3.8 billion for a two-thirds stake in the Russian dairy and juice maker Wimm-Bill-Dann Foods, giving the country a vote of confidence.

headline.main: Pepsi to Buy Russian Juice Maker for $3.8 Billion
